seriesJson.title: Politics in the twentieth century
seriesJson.description: This series consists of moderated panel discussions on American political affairs in the mid-20th century. It features Samuel Lubell, Professor Charles Nixon and others.

node.title: Ellis Island to Capitol Hill
node.description: This program, "Ellis Island to Capitol Hill," examines the impact that immigrant families have on American politics.

node.title: The Negro on the move
node.description: This program discusses the African-American role in American life and politics.

node.title: Whither Dixie
node.description: This program discusses changes in the American south.

node.title: What next for the unions
node.description: This program, "What Next for the Unions," is an examination of organized labor as a political force.

node.title: The waiting game
node.description: This program, "The Waiting Game," is an examination of domestic politics versus the Cold War.

node.title: Revolt of the moderates
node.description: The role of the middle class in contemporary politics.

node.title: The politics of revenge
node.description: This program, "The Politics of Revenge," is an examination of the myth of isolationism in American politics.

node.title: Divided we plow
node.description: This program, "Divided We Plow," is an examination of the place of the farmer in American politics.
